newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Sugar panel sets extra "B" quota output levy.
newsitem.headline: Sugar panel sets extra "B" quota output levy.

text.p: An extra production levy for "B" quota sugar was agreed by the European Union's sugar management committee to help finance subsidised exports of surpluses, EU sources said on Thursday.
The committee, at its weekly meeting on Wednesday, increased the "B" levy by a maximum allowable 7.5 percent to 39.5 percent of the minimum price for beet sugar.
The minimum prices are as follows (Ecus per tonne):
The EU cut the import duty on cane molasses to 0.04 Ecus per 100 kg, from 0.15 Ecus, the sources added.
The new duty, which came into effect on Thursday, was based on a cif reference price of 8.17 Ecus per 100 kg, against 8.06 Ecus the previous week.
Import duties on beet molasses remain suspended at zero while the reference price rose to 11.24 Ecus per 100 kg, from 11.16 Ecus.
